intro: Mentzelia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mentzelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb characterized by its slender, branched stems and linear, narrow leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow to greenish in color, often arranged in clusters. Mentzelia stenophylla thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils and open habitats. It is part of the Loasaceae family and is known for its ecological importance as a nectar source for pollinators.
